description:
This was reported for libvirt:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1155842

While Linux can mount a disk with an ISO format, windows wants the ISO added as a CD rom device.

This should be fixed in the XenAPI driver.

The latest cloud-init is able to read the config drive if its on Windows 2012 or later, and Windows 8 or later.
title: xenapi: iso config drive not visible on windows < 8 or 2012

comments.content:

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~johngarbutt

comments.content:
we can look to use the iso library we have for ISO boots, and use that to preset the ISO config_drive to Windows as a CD.

Its probably best to keep present it as a regular disk to linux, so it does not confuse things like auto_mount.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~johngarbutt

comments.content: This is similar for other hypervisors, its kinda a feature really
